hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 20 minutes on resilience.

We’ll be exploring the concept of grounding followed by time for reflection and sharing with each other.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. Now, would you like to start?

Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.
Find a comfortable position. I will start the audio exercise and we'll meet back here afterwards. > Tap play to start the audio exercise
Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own. How did you experience practising grounding? How did you feel before and after grounding? Did you notice any change?

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now. > Press play to start the timer. That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

content.text: We have spent some time together trying out different ways of grounding ourselves and noticing sensations within our bodies.

hostNotes.text: Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing

1. \*\*What is said in here, stays in here.\*\* 

2. \*\*All you need to do is listen.\*\* There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. \*\*Everything on the inside is okay.\*\* Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is. There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.
Who would like to start? > Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing. Thank you so much, everyone.

content.text: Which has been the best one for you (i.e. which has given you pleasant or neutral sensations)? Which one did not work for you?
When do you think you could use grounding?

hostNotes.text: Typically, we have already unconsciously developed a number of grounding techniques that help us feel relaxed, secure, safe, and better. These may include things like sitting in a certain way, folding our arms in a certain way, holding objects we like, lying a certain way on a couch or in bed, and so on.

Well done. Today, we’ve practised grounding. Grounding allows us to attend to the sensation at the point of contact of one’s body with objects or the ground to return to or stay in the resilient zone.
If we're up for it, we can continue with a mission: Practice using grounding on three different days this week.

Plan the steps you will take by considering moments when grounding might help you during your week. Before we leave this space, let’s do a mini check-out: How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two to three words.

Who would like to start? > Let everyone in the session check out one by one. Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today. > Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

content.text:
You have now started to build resources that you can use any time you need to regulate your mind and body. 

If you’re up for it, you can continue with this mission.

Typically, we have already unconsciously developed a number of grounding techniques that help us feel relaxed, secure, safe, and better. These may include things like sitting in a certain way, folding our arms in a certain way, holding objects we like, lying a certain way on a couch or in bed, and so on. Can you identify some grounding activities you do? Can you think of some new grounding practices?
content.heading: Well done

en.name: Grounding

hostNotes.text: > Press play to start the audio exercise

en.description: Grounding is noticing the physical contact our body has with things, including things we touch or how we are standing or sitting. Grounding can be a very helpful tool for calming the body and mind.

Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on xx

We’ll be doing xx ex. meditation followed by time for reflection and sharing with each other.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

Find a comfortable position. I will start the audio exercise and we'll meet back here afterwards. 

> Push play to start the audio exercise

Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own.

xxMain question

xxFurther explanations of main question if needed

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

Well done. If you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.
